snippet: With the new year, the T.S.A. has a chance to adopt “intelligence-driven, risk-based” rules and expand the known-traveler program.
abstract: Joe Sharkey On The Road column reviews current procedures for getting through airport security; calls on Transportation Security Administration to rethink its rules on restricted items and trusted travelers.

headline.main: Carry On a Christmas Pie, Not a Merry Snow Globe
headline.print_headline: Carry On a Christmas Pie, Not a Merry Snow Globe

snippet: Electronics retailing is a natural fit for airports because the merchandise, which is usually not large, can be sold in “small, efficient settings.”
abstract: Electronics retailing is becoming a growing presence in airports, seen as a natural fit among tech-savvy business travelers; merchandise can be sold in small, efficient settings and meet the needs of both travelers and retailers.

headline.main: At Airports, a Bigger Push to Sell Electronics

snippet: Frank McCourt has moved from his desperate fight to maintain ownership of the Los Angeles Dodgers to a battle with Fox Sports over the team’s TV rights.
abstract: Richard Sandomir Sports Business column on Los Angeles Dodgers owner Frank McCourt's latest public confrontation, this time in a court battle with Fox Sports over team's television rights.

headline.main: Dodgers Owner’s Feud Is Now With Fox
headline.print_headline: Dodgers Owner’s Feud Is Now With Fox

snippet: An app that helps you figure out the location and names of gas stations and restaurants available at your next highway exit.
abstract: An app that helps you figure out the location and names of gas stations and restaurants available at your next highway exit.

headline.main: App Smart Extra: Guide to Roadside Amenities

snippet: The antibank fervor of the Occupy Wall Street movement has entered college campuses, complicating the on-campus recruiting process for applicants and recruiters.

snippet: Ms. Peters’s death, like the last years of her life, occurred away from public view.

headline.main: Lana Peters, Stalin’s Daughter, Dies at 85
headline.print_headline: Lana Peters, 1926-2011: Stalin’s Daughter, Whose Escape Was Obscurity

snippet: FreeWarranty.com, a new shopping portal on the Web, says it will double the original manufacturer's warranty -- up to a year -- on all purchases.
